Title: Pan-cancer immune deconvolution and survival meta-analysis
Research_Question: How do inferred immune cell proportions relate to survival across TCGA cancers?
Hypothesis: Higher CD8+ T and dendritic proportions predict improved survival; suppressive myeloid states predict worse outcomes.

Title: Cross-cancer WGCNA modules and clinical endpoints
Research_Question: Do co-expression modules generalize across cancer types and associate with survival?
Hypothesis: Conserved cell-cycle, EMT, and immune modules explain survival variation.

Title: Splicing junction biomarkers from recount3 across cancers
Research_Question: Are alternative splicing patterns prognostic across tumor types?
Hypothesis: Recurrent junction usage predicts outcomes.

Title: Sex differences in tumor immune microenvironment
Research_Question: Are there sex-specific immune states linked to outcomes?
Hypothesis: Sex modifies immune infiltration and exhaustion states.

Title: Proteogenomic integration of CPTAC with transcriptomics
Research_Question: Which transcript–protein discordances are prognostic?
Hypothesis: Discordance indicates post-transcriptional regulation impacting outcomes.

Title: lncRNA signatures for prognosis across cancers
Research_Question: Can lncRNA expression stratify risk beyond coding genes?
Hypothesis: lncRNA modules add orthogonal prognostic signal.

Title: Batch effect diagnostics across TCGA cohorts
Research_Question: How do batch effects bias biomarker discovery?
Hypothesis: Residual batch explains a fraction of signatures; corrected pipelines reduce false positives.

Title: Cross-platform validation using GEO microarray + RNA-seq
Research_Question: Do RNA-seq signatures replicate on microarrays?
Hypothesis: Robust signatures replicate after harmonization.

Title: Cell-type–specific expression imputation in bulk
Research_Question: Can BayesPrism infer cell-type expression linked to outcomes?
Hypothesis: Imputed cell-type expression captures prognostic programs.

Title: Pan-cancer signature reproducibility score
Research_Question: How reproducible are published gene signatures?
Hypothesis: Only a subset are robust across cohorts and platforms.

Title: ICB response signatures from single-cell states
Research_Question: Which T cell/myeloid states predict ICB response?
Hypothesis: Conserved exhausted T and antigen-presenting myeloid states predict response.
Methods: Seurat/Scanpy; Harmony/scVI; pseudobulk; DA; bulk validation

Title: CAF subtypes and EMT programs across tumors
Research_Question: How do CAF states relate to EMT and outcomes?
Hypothesis: Myofibroblastic CAFs drive EMT and poor prognosis.

Title: Myeloid cell states across cancers
Research_Question: Are there universal myeloid activation states?
Hypothesis: Conserved MDSC-like and inflammatory states across TME.

Title: Spatial heterogeneity metrics predict outcomes
Research_Question: Do spatial mixing metrics associate with survival?
Hypothesis: Higher immune–tumor segregation predicts poor outcomes.

Title: Ligand–receptor rewiring under therapy
Research_Question: How do cell–cell interactions change post-therapy?
Hypothesis: Therapy reshapes myeloid–T cell signaling axes.

Title: Tumor antigen presentation failure landscape
Research_Question: How frequent are APM defects and where?
Hypothesis: APM defects cluster in immune-cold tumors.

Title: Trajectory of T cell exhaustion
Research_Question: Is exhaustion progression conserved?
Hypothesis: Conserved exhaustion continuum in ICB-naive tumors.

Title: TLS spatial niches
Research_Question: Are TLS signatures detectable and prognostic?
Hypothesis: TLS presence predicts improved outcomes.

Title: GBM integrative TME atlas
Research_Question: What microenvironments define GBM outcomes?
Hypothesis: Myeloid–tumor niches drive prognosis.

Title: B cell states and ICB benefit
Research_Question: Do B cell states/TLS predict ICB response?
Hypothesis: Activated B cells and TLS signatures predict benefit.

Title: AD bulk meta-analysis (multi-cohort)
Research_Question: What robust DE signatures track AD pathology?
Hypothesis: Glial activation and synaptic loss signatures reproduce across cohorts.

Title: Cell-type deconvolution vs Braak stage
Research_Question: Can cell-type proportions explain stage?
Hypothesis: Astro/microglia rise with stage; inhibitory neurons fall.

Title: Region-specific AD signatures
Research_Question: Do cortical regions show distinct signatures?
Hypothesis: MTG/ITG show unique inflammatory modules.

Title: Parkinson’s disease meta-analysis
Research_Question: What reproducible PD signatures emerge?
Hypothesis: Mitochondrial and dopaminergic neuron loss signals dominate.

Title: ALS transcriptomic meta-analysis
Research_Question: Are immune modules conserved in ALS?
Hypothesis: Innate immune activation conserved across cohorts.

Title: AD single-cell integration (SEA-AD + HCA)
Research_Question: Which cell states associate with cognition?
Hypothesis: Resilient neuronal states associate with better cognition.

Title: RNA velocity in AD inhibitory neurons
Research_Question: Do transitions predict decline?
Hypothesis: Stalled maturation trajectories mark decline.

Title: Spatial mapping of AD modules
Research_Question: Are AD modules spatially localized?
Hypothesis: Modules localize to pathology hotspots.

Title: Cross-disease: AD vs PD vs ALS
Research_Question: Which modules are shared vs disease-specific?
Hypothesis: Shared glial modules; disease-specific neuronal loss programs.

Title: Sex differences in AD transcriptomics
Research_Question: Do sex-specific modules explain risk?
Hypothesis: Female-biased inflammatory modules explain part of risk.

Title: Integrated brain single-cell atlas (HCA/Allen/SEA-AD)
Research_Question: Can a harmonized brain atlas enable cross-study comparisons?
Hypothesis: Harmony/scVI harmonization yields robust shared embeddings.

Title: GBM single-cell meta-atlas
Research_Question: What malignant cell states are conserved?
Hypothesis: Proneural/mesenchymal states recur across cohorts.

Title: Cross-species annotation (mouse→human brain)
Research_Question: Can domain adaptation improve annotation transfer?
Hypothesis: Adversarial/contrastive methods outperform baselines.

Title: totalVI multimodal embeddings
Research_Question: Do multimodal embeddings improve state discovery?
Hypothesis: totalVI improves rare-state detection.

Title: Rare cell type discovery benchmark
Research_Question: Which methods best detect rare states?
Hypothesis: Deep embeddings excel at low prevalence.

Title: Batch correction benchmark (Harmony vs scVI vs Seurat)
Research_Question: Which integration works best across labs?
Hypothesis: Performance varies by heterogeneity; provide guidance.

Title: Annotation transfer → bulk deconvolution
Research_Question: Do better annotations improve deconvolution?
Hypothesis: Improved references reduce error and bias.

Title: Spatial+single-cell joint breast cancer atlas
Research_Question: How do spatial niches align with scRNA states?
Hypothesis: Joint embeddings reveal prognostic niches.

Title: Single-cell trajectories in meningioma
Research_Question: What trajectories define benign vs aggressive?
Hypothesis: Distinct transitions predict recurrence.

Title: Fairness in single-cell embeddings
Research_Question: Do embeddings encode demographic biases?
Hypothesis: Bias correlates with donor distributions; propose mitigations.

Title: Deconvolution benchmark (BayesPrism/MuSiC/DWLS/Scaden)
Research_Question: Which methods are most accurate and robust?
Hypothesis: Bayesian methods excel with imperfect references.

Title: DE methods at n≤3 replicates
Research_Question: Which DE methods perform best at low n?
Hypothesis: limma-voom with quality weights is competitive.

Title: RNA velocity reliability across protocols
Research_Question: How robust is velocity across chemistries?
Hypothesis: Protocol affects inference; provide recommendations.

Title: Spatial ligand–receptor pipelines compared
Research_Question: Which LR pipelines agree most?
Hypothesis: Consensus improves interpretability.

Title: Cross-platform meta-analysis playbook
Research_Question: How to harmonize microarray & RNA-seq?
Hypothesis: Standardized pipeline yields reproducible results.

Title: Pipelines for low-resource labs
Research_Question: Can we cut compute cost without accuracy loss?
Hypothesis: Snakemake + mamba + CPU-friendly settings suffice.

Title: Open benchmarks & leaderboards (Bangla docs)
Research_Question: Can leaderboards drive method quality?
Hypothesis: Benchmarks accelerate progress & training.

Title: TCGA/AD demographic fairness analysis
Research_Question: Are findings sensitive to demographic imbalance?
Hypothesis: Bias impacts generalization; provide corrections.

Title: Packaged R/Python toolkits from this program
Research_Question: Can we unify utilities into robust packages?
Hypothesis: Well-documented packages boost reuse.

Title: Teaching modules & open curriculum
Research_Question: Can curriculum speed onboarding?
Hypothesis: Students reproduce at least 3 papers end-to-end.
